How to boost your productivity?

Posted 09 Feb,2025

By Martin Yvan

Web-Dev

Visual Studio Code (VS Code) is one of the most popular code editors among developers. Its flexibility and wealth of extensions make it a powerful tool to improve productivity.

In this article, we will see what a VS Code extension is, its usefulness, how it works and discover the 20 best extensions to optimize your workflow.

1Ô∏è‚É£ What is a VS Code extension?

An extension is an add-on that allows you to add new features to VS Code. These extensions can:

  • Improve the development experience
  • Automate certain repetitive tasks
  • Add debugging tools
  • Customize the interface

üìå How does an extension work?

Extensions are developed in JavaScript, TypeScript and HTML. They are available on the VS Code Marketplace and can be installed directly from the editor.

üì¢ Installing an extension:

  1. Open VS Code
  2. Go to the Extensions menu (Ctrl + Shift + X)
  3. Search for the desired extension
  4. Click Install

2Ô∏è‚É£ The 20 best VS Code extensions to boost your productivity

Here is a selection of the best extensions that will improve your efficiency as a developer.

üîπ 1. Prettier - Automatic code formatting

üîπ 2. ESLint - JavaScript code checking

üîπ 3. Bracket Pair Colorizer - Bracket pair coloring

üîπ 4. Live Server - Local server for web development

üîπ 5. GitLens - Advanced Git management

üîπ 6. Path Intellisense - Auto-complete file paths

üîπ 7. Debugger for Chrome - JavaScript debugging

üîπ 8. Auto Rename Tag - Automatic HTML tag renaming

üîπ 9. REST Client - Test APIs directly in VS Code

üîπ 10. Markdown All in One - Markdown editing improvements

üîπ 11. Todo Tree - Todo Tree Manager of tasks in the code

üîπ 12. CodeSnap - Generate code images for sharing

üîπ 13. Material Icon Theme - Improve the appearance of icons

üîπ 14. VS Code Icons - Icon pack to improve readability

üîπ 15. Better Comments - Improve comment management

üîπ 16. Peacock - Customize editor colors

üîπ 17. CSS Peek - Advanced navigation in CSS files

üîπ 18. Thunder Client - Lightweight alternative to Postman for testing APIs

üîπ 19. Project Manager - Advanced project management

üîπ 20. Code Time - Development time tracking

Each extension allows you to gain productivity and better organize your work on VS Code.

Conclusion

Extensions play a key role in optimizing development on VS Code. By installing the right tools for your workflow, you can speed up your productivity and make your coding experience smoother and more enjoyable. üöÄ

What is your favorite extension? Share it in the comments!
